name: NPR
text:
As much as 95% of Kaziranga National Park in India may be underwater, following severe rain and flooding.

Now, officials are working to save stranded animals ‚Äî including the area's rare one-horned rhinos.
https://t.co/0TyY63v69D

name: NPR
text:
The launch of the James Webb Space Telescope ‚Äî the long-awaited successor to the Hubble Space Telescope ‚Äî has been pushed back yet another seven months, NASA says.
https://t.co/gUUSCBewk5

name: NPR
text:
2020 has been a lot ‚Äî and Iceland is ready to help.

The tourist board has developed an app that lets you record a scream, pent up by the pandemic, then broadcasts it from speakers in the Icelandic wilderness.
https://t.co/hvhJrhv80l

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRItsBeenAMin: .@ziwe has been asking uncomfortable questions all her life. So now with her popular Instagram Live show, she doesn‚Äôt shy away from asking her famous guests frank questions about race.

More of her chat with @samsanders: https://t.co/YlgNxlWEY8 https://t.co/6z2fBOYt9G

name: NPR
text:
A spike in coronavirus cases in Colombia has forced many cities to issue new lockdown orders.  

Some people have turned to looting in order to survive ‚Äî one scramble to steal gasoline ended in a hellish fireball.
https://t.co/iSMfrhggSb

name: NPR
text:
The NCAA released new guidelines on how colleges might resume sports ‚Äî but admits the outlook is getting worse, not better. 

Earlier guidelines assumed that national testing strategies and enhanced contact tracing would be in place.
https://t.co/hp5c44QBsH

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRItsBeenAMin: ‚ú® NEW EPISODE ‚ú®

What's college without a campus? @samsanders checks in with @tressiemcphd about the state of higher education and coronavirus.

Also, a chat with @ziwe on the art of the interview and her comfort with discomfort.

üîä LISTEN NOW: https://t.co/YlgNxmefPG

name: NPR
text: Senate and House Democrats have issued letters urging the Trump administration to reverse its decision to order hospitals to stop reporting critical COVID-19 data directly to the CDC. https://t.co/V5qNOdghEM

name: NPR
text:
Most California schools will likely remain closed when the academic year begins in the fall, according to new state rules, with a majority shifting to distance-learning.

"Learning is non-negotiable ... but only if it can be done safely," Gov. Newsom said.
https://t.co/z5vluBeFcO

name: NPR
text:
Indiana officials have charged 2 white men who were filmed in an attack on a Black man at a state park on July 4.

Vauhxx Booker says the men beat him, pinned him to a tree, shouted racist slurs at him, then called for someone to "get a noose."
https://t.co/qWaqr8x1aU

name: NPR
text:
The drive to reopen churches around the country appears to be losing momentum amid a surge of COVID-19 cases. 

A recent survey shows 5% of pastors now say their churches will not resume in-person worship for the remainder of 2020.
https://t.co/nEBv4yhY5v

name: NPR
text:
A day after issuing an executive order barring cities from implementing mask mandates, Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp urged residents to wear masks for 4 weeks ‚Äî but said he wouldn't order it.

LaGrange Mayor Jim Thornton told NPR he's "reluctant" to defy Kemp.
https://t.co/of1yrWxTpk

name: NPR
text:
The $600 federal unemployment benefit is set to expire this month. 

"Families are going to face high rates of eviction, homelessness, food insecurity, hunger," an economist says. https://t.co/L7hi15WerD

name: NPR
text:
As the coronavirus shut down homeless shelters in Southern Oregon, civic leaders told those in need to relocate to the nearby woods. 

Now sheriff's deputies are relocating them again before fire season. https://t.co/EhJtGqMDsP

name: NPR
text: The brazen security compromise at Twitter this week underscored the broad and lingering vulnerabilities of U.S. elections to sophisticated cyberattacks. https://t.co/qMzv1WYRm1

name: NPR
text: For more than 70 years, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has been the trusted expert around the world on outbreaks and widespread illnesses. This is how it built that reputation -- and why it's been attacked this year. @gpbnews https://t.co/BhCXnMZiO8

name: NPR
NPR
text: Pioneering dubstep producer @mala_dmz talks about meeting @jamesblake for the first time, wielding minimalism as a way to inspire imagination, and the late Augustus Pablo. https://t.co/0xZitEnF3W

name: NPR
text:
"Gaslighter" is country trio @thechicks' (formerly Dixie Chicks) first new album in 14 years. 

In some ways, the world has finally caught up to the band since it fell out of public favor in 2003. https://t.co/Xhaet0pcXV

name: NPR
text:
The big summer action movie is one of the things we've been missing this year ‚Äî and now, we've got a good one. 

"The Old Guard" stars Charlize Theron and KiKi Layne as members of a timeless fighter squad. https://t.co/MDCzx1ns8V

name: NPR
text:
Sucker Punch's new samurai combat game gives players a gorgeous open world to explore, haikus to write and enemies to defeat ‚Äî but the characters can be flat, leading to moments of dull gameplay.
 https://t.co/b3PvZ38IBG

name: NPR
text:
COVID-19 hospital data in Kansas and Missouri is suddenly incomplete or missing following the Trump administration's change to how it's collected. 
https://t.co/N4D95QwCpj

name: NPR
text:
üè• How do you look after a family member who's been diagnosed with COVID-19 and is at home? 

üíó How do you show support for a friend with the virus?

We‚Äôre answering your coronavirus questions üëá
https://t.co/OLtBjKcMBm

name: NPR
text: Meet the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery's first-ever Instagram artist-in-residence: Howard University architecture professor and sketch artist Brad Grant. @wamu885 https://t.co/3UUxck4OXg

name: NPR
text:
The City of Oakland's settlement over the 2016 "Ghost Ship" fire that killed 36 people provides $23.5 million to families of those who died and $9.2 million to Sam Maxwell, who survived the fire with lifelong injuries. 
https://t.co/PRqxoJxGLk

name: NPR
text:
The number of multiracial churches is growing, but leaders of color who work in them still see attitudes of white supremacy.

‚ÄúYou have to abandon some of your ethnic culture and become more palatable to the majority white culture," says a Black pastor. https://t.co/61ELNSzkTm

name: NPR
text: Walmart says shoppers must wear masks inside its stores starting Monday. It's the largest retailer to implement a mask requirement so far. https://t.co/84d9GasX1j

name: NPR
text:
"It is my hope and my prayer that what I've tried to do will inspire another generation of young people ... to make our planet better for all of us and those that are yet to be born." ‚Äî Congressman John Lewis on the @BitterSouth podcast (@mygpb) 

Listen: https://t.co/B3Au6MvGzO https://t.co/HiPBzhXHY2

name: NPR
text:
One woman has connected with hundreds of people who got stranded from their pets because of pandemic lockdowns and travel restrictions ‚Äî and is organizing a charter flight to reunite them.

She's calling it "Mission Impawsible."
https://t.co/rumTNy2hPd

name: NPR
text:
RT @gpbnews: PHOTOS: Our GPB staff remember the legacy of Civil Rights icon Rep. #JohnLewis through photos and quotes. 

"You can keep a work of art for years to come, for generations to come. But as humans, we come on the scene and we disappear." - John Lewis

https://t.co/E6la3Cb2HY

name: NPR
text:
The Biden campaign admits that one of its most effective weapons against President Trump is Trump himself, what he says and how he acts.

"When your opponent is destroying himself, don't interrupt," one Democratic strategist agrees. https://t.co/NALYP7dadd

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: From our archives: Listen to Rep. John Lewis describe the first time he met Martin Luther King Jr. https://t.co/fihI64HHAF
